Description: Deep Egyptian blue 'shabti': in form and details the 'shabti' is traditional with a lappet wig, clasping a hoe in each hand while a basket is represented pendent in the centre of the back. Incised with text. The eyes and eyebrows were inlaid but only the inlays of the eyes are preserved. They are of white and black opaque glass and, doubtless, the eyelines and eyebrows were also of white glass. This sculpture was moulded and fired. Preserved broken through knees and assembled.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
